title: Strengthening Clinical Practical Skills: MEMS Gyroscope Control System Design and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Control Theory, Understanding of Differential Equations, Proficiency in MATLAB/Python, and Basic Concepts of Linear Algebra
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically model the dynamics of MEMS gyroscopes using equations and implement simulations
Learners can design hybrid learning control algorithms combining sliding mode control (SMC) and neural networks (NN) and analyze their performance
Learners can develop controllers achieving finite-time system convergence performance by applying non-singular terminal sliding mode control (NTSMC)
Learners can define performance limits based on time-varying barrier Lyapunov functions (BLF) and integrate them into control systems
Learners can quantitatively evaluate and improve tracking precision of MEMS gyroscopes under various uncertainty conditions through project-based learning
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
